title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement: Pedro L. Godoy Bethany Allen. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to palaeoverse
text: part Palaeoverse project, adopted set structures standards follow contributing development rmacrostrat. like contribute rmacrostrat toolkit, strongly advise reading document first. plan contribute function rmacrostrat, first raise issue via GitHub repository. way development team can assess whether function suitable needed rmacrostrat toolkit prior submission.

title: Contributing to palaeoverse
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly GitHub, provided done source file. means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R file, .Rd file.

title: Contributing to palaeoverse
text: like make substantial change, first file issue make sure someone development team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug reproducible example.

title: Contributing to palaeoverse
text: (contributor) clone desired repository (.e. rmacrostrat R package) personal computer. changes made, switch new git branch (.e., main branch). changes complete, can submit changes merging via pull request (“PR”) GitHub. Note complete pull request include succinct description (see function template) code changes , proper documentation (via roxygen2), unit tests (via testthat). description required initial pull request code review (see ), pull requests merged contain complete documentation tests. don’t feel comfortable implementing changes , can submit bug report feature request GitHub issue proper repository (e.g. rmacrostrat issues).

title: Contributing to palaeoverse
text: pull requests must reviewed two core developers rmacrostrat merging. review process ensure contributions 1) meet standards expectations described , 2) successfully perform functions claim perform, 3) don’t break parts codebase. Submitting pull request one palaeoverse R packages automatically initiate R CMD check, lintr check, test coverage check via GitHub Actions. checks conduct automatic review ensure package broken new code code matches style guide (see ), manual review still required pull request can merged. Reviewers may questions reviewing pull request. expected respond questions via GitHub. fixes /changes required, expected make changes. required changes minor enough, reviewers may make , expected. questions lack background make required changes, work reviewer determine plan attack.

title: Contributing to palaeoverse
text: Please note contributing rmacrostrat agree general community Code Conduct.

title: Fetch data from Macrostrat — GET_macrostrat
text: function fetches data Macrostrat via Application Programming Interface (API). core function handling user requests.

title: Fetch data from Macrostrat — GET_macrostrat
text: path character. API path retrieve data Macrostrat. query character. API query retreive data Macrostrat.

title: Fetch data from Macrostrat — GET_macrostrat
text: data.frame user-requested data.

title: root and API version — api_ver
text: root API version

title: Get available content — get_available_content
text: function checks whether requested content available. can used either return available content requested variable standardise requested content.

title: Get available content — get_available_content
code: get_available_content(   x = NULL,   path = NULL,   query = NULL,   var = NULL,   available = TRUE )

title: Get available content — get_available_content
text: x character. requested content value (e.g. "international ages"). path character. relevant Macrostrat API path. query list. variable extract returned object check x . var character. variable filter content . available logical. available content returned desired query?

title: Get available content — get_available_content
text: vector available content matched x value.

title: Get available content — get_available_content
text: function checks whether requested content available via Macrostrat. can also used return vector available content desired query.

what: Get lithology data from Macrostrat — get_lithology
title: Get lithology data from Macrostrat — get_lithology
text: function gets lithology data Macrostrat.

title: Get lithology data from Macrostrat — get_lithology
Get lithology data from Macrostrat — get_lithology
text: x character. name lithology available via Macrostrat. character. rank search name , either: "name", "group", "type", "class". available logical. set TRUE, vector available lithologies returned. set FALSE (default), requested lithology checked available.

title: Get lithology data from Macrostrat — get_lithology
text: vector available lithologies data.frame requested Macrostrat lithology containing least following columns: lith_id Lithology ID number. name Name lithology. type Type lithology. group Group lithology. class Class lithology. color Assigned lithology colour.

title: Get lithology data from Macrostrat — get_lithology
text: function returns data.frame requested lithology related data. Available Macrostrat lithologies can requested via available argument. Note: argument set TRUE, vector available lithologies returned. return desired lithology, argument set FALSE.

title: Get lithology data from Macrostrat — get_lithology

title: Check available options — get_options
text: function checks options available.

title: Check available options — get_options
code: get_options(x = NULL, route = NULL, path = NULL)

title: Check available options — get_options
text: x character. options checked? Choose "parameters", "output_formats", "examples", "fields". argument set NULL (default), options returned. route character. first-level route checked "defs" "columns". path character. second-level route checked "columns" "minerals" route "defs".

title: Check available options — get_options
text: list available "parameters", "output_formats", "examples", "fields". x, route, path set NULL, base routes returned.

what: Get Macrostrat project statistics from Macrostrat — get_stats
title: Get Macrostrat project statistics from Macrostrat — get_stats
text: function gets specific statistics Macrostrat projects Macrostrat.

title: Get Macrostrat project statistics from Macrostrat — get_stats
Get Macrostrat project statistics from Macrostrat — get_stats
text: x character. name project available via Macrostrat. available logical. set TRUE, vector available projects returned. set FALSE (default), requested project checked available.

title: Get Macrostrat project statistics from Macrostrat — get_stats
text: vector available projects data.frame requested Macrostrat project statistics containing: project_id project ID number. project name project. columns number geological columns associated project. packages number geological packages associated project. units number geological units associated project. pbdb_collections number Paleobiology Database collections associated project. measurements number measurements associated project. t_polys number polygons(?) associated project.

title: Get Macrostrat project statistics from Macrostrat — get_stats
text: function returns data.frame requested project stats. Available Macrostrat project statistics can requested via available argument. Note: argument set TRUE, vector available project names returned. return desired project statistics, argument set FALSE.

title: Get Macrostrat project statistics from Macrostrat — get_stats
code: # Get available timescales available <- get_stats(available = TRUE) # Get all stats all <- get_stats() # Get project specific nz <- get_stats(x = "New Zealand")

what: Get timescale data from Macrostrat — get_timescale
title: Get timescale data from Macrostrat — get_timescale
text: function gets timescale data Macrostrat.

title: Get timescale data from Macrostrat — get_timescale
Get timescale data from Macrostrat — get_timescale
text: x character. name timescale available via Macrostrat. available logical. set TRUE, vector available timescales returned. set FALSE (default), requested scale checked available.

title: Get timescale data from Macrostrat — get_timescale
text: vector available timescales data.frame requested Macrostrat timescale containing: name Interval name. abbrev Interval name abbreviation. t_age Interval top age, .e. minimum age. b_age Interval bottom age, .e. maximum age. color Assigned interval colour.

title: Get timescale data from Macrostrat — get_timescale
text: function returns data.frame requested timescale. Available Macrostrat timescales can requested via available argument. Note: argument set TRUE, vector available scales returned. return desired timescale, argument set FALSE.

title: Get timescale data from Macrostrat — get_timescale
code: # Get available timescales available <- get_timescale(available = TRUE) # Get timescale data ages <- get_timescale(x = "international ages") periods <- get_timescale(x = "international periods")

what: rmacrostrat: Fetch Data from the Macrostrat Platform — rmacrostrat-package
title: rmacrostrat: Fetch Data from the Macrostrat Platform — rmacrostrat-package
text: Work Macrostrat Web Service (https://macrostrat.org/) fetch geological data relevant spatial temporal distribution sedimentary, igneous, metamorphic rocks well data extracted .

title: rmacrostrat: Fetch Data from the Macrostrat Platform — rmacrostrat-package
text: Maintainer: Lewis . Jones LewisA.Jones@outlook.com (ORCID) Authors: William Gearty willgearty@gmail.com (ORCID)
